t: Luke 16
The Parable of the Unjust Steward

He*p also said to His disciples: “There*r was*r a*r certain*r rich*r man*r who*r had*r a*r steward,*r and*r an*r accusation*r was*r brought*r to*r him*r that*r this*r man*r was*r wasting*r his*r goods.*r
So*r he*r called*r him*r and*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘What*r is*r this*r I*r hear*r about*r you?*r Give*r an*r account*r of*r your*r stewardship,*r for*r you*r can*r no*r longer*r be*r steward.’*r

“Then*rp the*r steward*r said*r within*r himself,*r ‘What*r shall*r I*r do?*r For*r my*r master*r is*r taking*r the*r stewardship*r away*r from*r me.*r I*r cannot*r dig;*r I*r am*r ashamed*r to*r beg.*r
I*r have*r resolved*r what*r to*r do,*r that*r when*r I*r am*r put*r out*r of*r the*r stewardship,*r they*r may*r receive*r me*r into*r their*r houses.’*r
“So*rp he*r called*r every*r one*r of*r his*r master’s*r debtors*r to*r him,*ir and*r said*r to*r the*r first,*r ‘How*r much*r do*r you*r owe*r my*r master?’*r
And*r he*r said,*r ‘A*r hundred*r measures*r of*r oil.’*r So*r he*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘Take*r your*r bill,*r and*r sit*r down*r quickly*r and*r write*r fifty.’*r

Then*r he*r said*r to*r another,*r ‘And*r how*r much*r do*r you*r owe?’*r So*r he*r said,*r ‘A*r hundred*r measures*r of*r wheat.’*r And*r he*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘Take*r your*r bill,*r and*r write*r eighty.’*r

So*r the*r master*r commended*r the*r unjust*r steward*r because*r he*r had*r dealt*r shrewdly.*r For*r the*r sons*r of*r this*r world*r are*r more*r shrewd*r in*r their*r generation*r than*r the*r sons*r of*r light.*r
“And*rp I*r say*r to*r you,*r make*r friends*r for*r yourselves*r by*r unrighteous*r mammon,*r that*r when*r you*r fail,*r they*r may*r receive*r you*r into*r an*r everlasting*r home.*r
He*r who*r is*ir faithful*r in*r what*ir is*ir least*r is*r faithful*r also*r in*r much;*r and*r he*r who*r is*r unjust*r in*r what*ir is*ir least*r is*r unjust*r also*r in*r much.*r
Therefore*r if*r you*r have*r not*r been*r faithful*r in*r the*r unrighteous*r mammon,*r who*r will*r commit*r to*r your*r trust*r the*r true*r riches?*ir
And*r if*r you*r have*r not*r been*r faithful*r in*r what*r is*r another*r man’s,*r who*r will*r give*r you*r what*r is*r your*r own?*r

“No*rp servant*r can*r serve*r two*r masters;*r for*r either*r he*r will*r hate*r the*r one*r and*r love*r the*r other,*r or*r else*r he*r will*r be*r loyal*r to*r the*r one*r and*r despise*r the*r other.*r You*r cannot*r serve*r God*r and*r mammon.”*r
The Law, the Prophets, and the Kingdom
Now*p the Pharisees, who were lovers of money, also heard all these things, and they derided Him.

And He said to them, “You*r are*r those*r who*r justify*r yourselves*r before*r men,*r but*r God*r knows*r your*r hearts.*r For*r what*r is*r highly*r esteemed*r among*r men*r is*r an*r abomination*r in*r the*r sight*r of*r God.*r
“The*rp law*r and*r the*r prophets*r were*ir until*r John.*r Since*r that*r time*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r has*r been*r preached,*r and*r everyone*r is*r pressing*r into*r it.*r
And*r it*r is*r easier*r for*r heaven*r and*r earth*r to*r pass*r away*r than*r for*r one*r tittle*r of*r the*r law*r to*r fail.*r
“Whoever*rp divorces*r his*r wife*r and*r marries*r another*r commits*r adultery;*r and*r whoever*r marries*r her*r who*r is*r divorced*r from*r her*ir husband*r commits*r adultery.*r
The Rich Man and Lazarus
“There*rp was*r a*r certain*r rich*r man*r who*r was*r clothed*r in*r purple*r and*r fine*r linen*r and*r fared*r sumptuously*r every*r day.*r
But*r there*r was*r a*r certain*r beggar*r named*r Lazarus,*r full*r of*r sores,*r who*r was*r laid*r at*r his*r gate,*r
desiring*r to*r be*r fed*r with*r the*r crumbs*r which*r fell*r from*r the*r rich*r man’s*r table.*r Moreover*r the*r dogs*r came*r and*r licked*r his*r sores.*r
So*r it*r was*r that*r the*r beggar*r died,*r and*r was*r carried*r by*r the*r angels*r to*r Abraham’s*r bosom.*r The*r rich*r man*r also*r died*r and*r was*r buried.*r
And*r being*r in*r torments*r in*r Hades,*r he*r lifted*r up*r his*r eyes*r and*r saw*r Abraham*r afar*r off,*r and*r Lazarus*r in*r his*r bosom.*r

“Then*rp he*r cried*r and*r said,*r ‘Father*r Abraham,*r have*r mercy*r on*r me,*r and*r send*r Lazarus*r that*r he*r may*r dip*r the*r tip*r of*r his*r finger*r in*r water*r and*r cool*r my*r tongue;*r for*r I*r am*r tormented*r in*r this*r flame.’*r

But*r Abraham*r said,*r ‘Son,*r remember*r that*r in*r your*r lifetime*r you*r received*r your*r good*r things,*r and*r likewise*r Lazarus*r evil*r things;*r but*r now*r he*r is*r comforted*r and*r you*r are*r tormented.*r

And*r besides*r all*r this,*r between*r us*r and*r you*r there*r is*r a*r great*r gulf*r fixed,*r so*r that*r those*r who*r want*r to*r pass*r from*r here*r to*r you*r cannot,*r nor*r can*r those*r from*r there*r pass*r to*r us.’*r
“Then*p he said, ‘I*r beg*r you*r therefore,*r father,*r that*r you*r would*r send*r him*r to*r my*r father’s*r house,*r
for*r I*r have*r five*r brothers,*r that*r he*r may*r testify*r to*r them,*r lest*r they*r also*r come*r to*r this*r place*r of*r torment.’*r
Abraham*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘They*r have*r Moses*r and*r the*r prophets;*r let*r them*r hear*r them.’*r
And*r he*r said,*r ‘No,*r father*r Abraham;*r but*r if*r one*r goes*r to*r them*r from*r the*r dead,*r they*r will*r repent.’*r
But*r he*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘If*r they*r do*r not*r hear*r Moses*r and*r the*r prophets,*r neither*r will*r they*r be*r persuaded*r though*r one*r rise*r from*r the*r dead.’”*r
